flawed_nl_solution:
The total marks Amaya scored more in Music than in Maths is 1/10 * 70 = <<1/10*70=700/1>>700/1 marks.
So the total marks she scored in Maths is 70 - 700/1 = <<70-700/1=-630>>-630 marks.
If she scored 20 marks fewer in Maths than in Arts, then he scored -630 + 20 = <<-630+20=-610>>-610 in Arts.
If she scored 10 marks more in Social Studies than in Music, then she scored 70 + 10 = <<10+70=80>>80 marks in Social Studies.
The total number of marks for all the subjects is 70 + -630 + -610 + 80 = <<70+-630+-610+80=-1090>>-1090 marks.
#### -1090

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 7, not 700/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
